location.activity-description: Le projet vise à renforcer les capacités du systeme des aires protegées du Burundi afin qu'il soit capable d'executer son mandat de conservation de la biodiversité grace à l'engagement des parties prenantes

location.name: Karuzi Province
location.activity-description: Amélioration de l'efficacité du système de gestion des aires protégées

location.name: Muyinga Province
location.activity-description: Amélioration de l'efficacité du système de gestion des aires protégées

result.title: Objective
result.description: To enhance efficiency of the protected areas system for biodiversity conservation in Burundi through stakeholdersâ€™ engagement

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Change in RAPPAM assessment

baseline.comment:
Kibira NP
y: 30
m/y: 12
m/n: 20
n: 87
Ruvubu NP
y: 24
m/y: 16
m/n: 16
n: 93

target.comment:
30% of RAPPAM questions (45 of 149) improve by at least one increment;
At least 50 increment improvements overall;

actual.comment: Nothing to report. No assessment has been conducted

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Change in revenues of local communities living around the 2 selected PAs

baseline.comment: Encroachment of PA resources by local communities are progressively decreaing because of local communities involvement in parks conservation

target.comment: At least 500 householdsâ€™ income is augmented by 30% in year 4

actual.comment: 240 riparian households received 260 goat around Kibira and 300 poachers had 300 goats around Ruvubu. This enhanced their livestock and agricultural production. Thanks to these alternative economic activities, combined to the accrued control of the two park areas, the PA encroachment remarkably decreased.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Change in financial resources available for the PA system by year 4 of the project

baseline.comment: Only US $ 20,000 is allocated per year to each one of the two PA (Ruvubu and Kibira) for their management by the Government

target.comment: New stream of Financial resources reach at least US $150,000 per year for both Kibira and Ruvubu NP by year 4 of the project

actual.comment: The government is taking in charge technical and institutional services for the two parks, for around 100,000 USD. However, mechanisms for a full self-financing through eco-tourism are not yet established.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Almost 1000 ha cultivated in Kibira national park

baseline.comment: 1000 ha destroyed in Kibira national park

target.comment: All ha destroyed before the project reconstituted

actual.comment: Destroyed sites were identified and a study for their rehabilitation was conducted. 123000 eucalyptus plants replaced at destroyed limits for the Kibira park delimitation. There was also a natural reconstitution of the parks consecutive to the staying patrols, sensitization and creation of alternative activities around the PA, which limited the destruction by riparian populations.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Populations of chimpanzees (Pan troglodytes), Montane Mouse Shrew (Myosorex blarina) in Kibira NP and leopard (Panthera pardus) in Ruvubu NP

baseline.comment: 300 chimpanzees identified in Kibira forest and no leopard identified in Ruvubu national park but no national programm of monotoring is set up until now , It will be put in place next year

target.comment: At least, no change in population size

actual.comment: No incident related to chimpanzee population was reported and new nests are regularly seen Inside the park The population remains the same

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Building institutional capacity for the participatory management of the protected areas system in Burundi

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Laws and guidelines for a participatory management of the PA system

baseline.comment: New law for portected areas management that take into account participative of the local communities signed in 2011

target.comment: National biodiversity law signed

actual.comment: The biodiversity law is pending government approval. The new law on PA was translated in national language and vulgarized. Two strategies for alternative incomes were developed and implemented.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Strategies and tools for information, communication, sensitizing and training

baseline.comment: There is now strategy but tools are to be developped

target.comment: Tools for information, communication, sensitizing and training are elaborated and utilized

actual.comment: The implementation of the communication strategy on biodiversity conservation and protection continued. Sessions of training, information and education on the matter were organized in favor media actors, the riparian communities and other actors.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Capacity Assessment Scorecard

baseline.comment:
Policy Formulation
Systemic 3/out of 6
Institutional 2/out of 3
Implementation
Systemic 5/out of 9
Institutional 10/out of 27
Individual 3/out of 12
Engagement and consensus
Systemic 3/out of 6
Institutional 3/out of 6
Individual 2/out of 3
Info and knowledge
Systemic 1/out of 3
Institutional 1/out of 3
Individual 2/out of 3
Monitoring
Systemic 4/out of 6
Institutional 4/out of 6
Individual 0/out of 3

target.comment:
Policy Formulation
5/out of 6
3/out of 3
Implementation
6/out of 9
10/out of 27
5/out of 12
Eng and consensus
3/out of 6
4/out of 6
3/out of 3
Info and knowledge
2/out of 3
2/out of 3
3/out of 3
Monitoring
3/out of 6
5/out of 6
1/out of 3

actual.comment: Institutional support was provided to the Burundian Office for the Protection of the Environment (OBPE) in order to enhance its capacities in the preservation of the biodiversity. Hence, PA managers were trained in PA management and geographical information system, while at the central level, there was a capacity building in policy development.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: A strategy for self-financing & alternative income generation of the PA system

baseline.comment: A strategy of income genration for local communities is being developped by Consltants

target.comment: A strategy for alternative income generation of the PA system is developed by 2

actual.comment: Consultants were not recruited due to the civil unrest which broke out in the country, restricting the presence of international staff to the critical ones only. No change is recorded.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
Improved financial sustainability for NSPA, as measured by the
Financial Sustainability Scorecard

baseline.comment:
Legal and regulatory framework
19.2% - 15 out of 78
Business planning
8.2% - 5 out of 61
Tools for revenue generation
8.8% - 5 out of 57
Total
12.7% - 25 out of 196

actual.comment: Not yet assessed

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: PA platform (National and communal frameworks for coordination, participatory management and exchange of information on PA actions)

baseline.comment: There are committees formed by local communities to participate in the management of PA and for sharing benefits generated therein.

target.comment: A PA platform is established and functional by year 3

actual.comment: All the communal and provincial committees in riparian areas of the Kibira and Ruvubu are operational. The national framework will be put in place after the elections.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of INECN staff and partners trained in participatory PA management

baseline.comment: Staff at low level (Rangers) and local committes have limited capacities & knowledge of participatory management of PA.

target.comment: At least 50 staff for INECN and partners are trained by year 4

actual.comment: 21 additional persons were trained (13 OBPE staff and 8 from the civil society).

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: INECN infrastructures and equipments

baseline.comment: Human, material and financial capacities of INECN to run protected areas and to accomplish its mission with participatory management are very limited.

target.comment: INECN infrastructures and PA management are refurbished and operational by end of year 3

actual.comment: Plans and proforma for building the office of the PA of Ruvubu were developed. Works are underway.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Participatory management of Kibira and Ruvubu National Parks

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Limits of the Kibira and Ruvubu National Parks

baseline.comment: Limits of the Kibira national park are to be soon materialized because a local association is working on

target.comment: Limits of the Kibira and Ruvubu National Parks are known, materialized and secured by year 3 of the project

actual.comment: Around 1100 ha were recovered following the PA limits setting.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Management Effectiveness of PAs at project sites as measured by the METT Scorecard (Annex E)

baseline.comment:
Kibira NP 41.6%
Ruvubu NP 34.3%

target.comment:
Kibira NP 55%
Ruvubu NP 50%

actual.comment: 50.1 kms of road in Ruvubu PA and 38 kms in Kibira are under rehabilitation, for a better control of the 2 PA.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of PA hectares (ha) within KNP and RNP under improved management effectiveness

baseline.comment: The total number of PA hectares of Kibira and Ruvubu national park under improving management because local communities are involved through committes.

target.comment: 100% under management effectiveness

actual.comment: The total area is now under control by OBPE

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Numbers of community groups involved in participatory management of the 2 PAs

baseline.comment: No local community group for PA management is currently existing

target.comment: 10 communty groups around Kibira national park and 10 around Ruvubu national park by year 4

actual.comment: 44 committees at the provincial, communal and community levels for Kibira, and 92 for the Ruvubu are involved in the participatory surveillance of the parks.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Existence of cross border biodiversity management in Ruvubu NP, with Tanzania

baseline.comment: There is currently no collaboration between the 2 countries for the management of the Ruvubu

target.comment: Cross border biodiversity management is operational by year 4

actual.comment: The collaboration with Tanzania has not yet been established.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Participatory management plans for Kibira and Ruvubu NP

baseline.comment: There is a management plan for Kibira and no one for Ruvubu national park

target.comment: Participatory management plans are updated (Kibira NP) or developed (Ruvubu NP) and applied by year 2

actual.comment: The 2 plans are now valid

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Existence of ecotourism business plan

baseline.comment: No organized, profitable ecotourism exists based on the rich fauna of Kibira and Ruvubu NP

target.comment: By year 3 of project, a business plan for fauna-oriented ecotourism exists in both NP

actual.comment: TDRs were prepared and consultants are to be recruited.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Change in revenues of local communities living around the 2 selected PAs

baseline.comment: There is no alternative to generate income around the PA, apart from rare experiences that local NGO started in the Nile Basin Initiative with 4 micro-realizations with IUCN livelihood project.

target.comment: At least 800 householdsâ€™ income is augmented by 30% in year 4

actual.comment: In total, 669 riparian household around Kibira are practicing alternative economic activities: 240 household received goatsand 429 received materials for apiculture. For Ruvubu, 165 goats habe been given to 165 poachers converted in co,servation actors and 135 others are being purchased for the same people. In tota 300 personnes will have goats around Ruvubu which will make à global total of 969 riparian households involved in alternative revenus generation.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Change in financial resources available for the PA system by year 4 of the project

baseline.comment: Only US $20,000 are allocated per year to each one of the two PA (Ruvubu and Kibira) for their management by the Government. Ecotourism income is very limited.

target.comment: New stream of Financial resources reaches at least US $150,000 per year for both Kibira and Ruvubu NP by year 4 of the project

actual.comment: The government is taking in charge technical and institutional services for the two parks, for around 100,000 USD. However, mechanisms for a full self-financing through eco-tourism are not yet established.

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: Monitoring programme to track changes in BD status, threats and effectiveness of PA management

baseline.comment: There is no monitoring programme

target.comment: Monitoring programme in place to track changes in biodiversity status, threats and effectiveness of management of the 2 PA

actual.comment: The monitoring system is not yet set
